description.plain:
Jeffery Lamar Williams (b. August 16, 1991), popularly known as Young Thug, is an innovative trap artist from Atlanta known for his experimental vocal styles on versatile production ranging from hard trap beats to experimental pop records. Thug is known as a pioneer for much of the 2010s generation of rap, and his constant cosigns, features, and chart presence cement his status as a leader in the streaming era and current rap scene.

While Young Thug released his first mixtape in 2011, it wasn’t until fellow ATL trap artist Gucci Mane took Thug under his wing in 2013 that he began to see great success as an artist. That year, Thug released his first major hit, “Stoner,” which quickly gained viral traction on social media, then “Danny Glover,” which propelled him to an even larger scale of success. After Gucci Mane went to prison in 2013, Thug saw success by re-aligning himself with Cash Money Records’s own Birdman and his newly-formed Rich Gang collective with the hit single “Lifestyle” and a collaborative mixtape before officially signing to 300 Ent. in 2015. Under 300, Thug continued to release many more singles, mixtapes, and features, gradually boosting his popularity before releasing his debut album, So Much Fun, which topped the Billboard 200 on August 31, 2019.

After 2015’s “Best Friend” became Thug’s first platinum single, his 2016 collaboration with Travis Scott, “pick up the phone,” became his new highest-charting song on the Billboard Hot 100. This would later be succeeded by “Havana” with Camila Cabello, the best-selling single of 2018. However, his current highest-charting song as lead artist is “Hot,” which topped the Rolling Stone 100 and peaked at #11 on the Billboard Hot 100, surpassing his previous biggest hit, “The London,” which peaked at #12 on the Billboard Hot 100.

In 2017, Young Thug officially founded his own label, Young Stoner Life Records, consisting of Lil Duke, Gunna, Lil Keed, and Wheezy, among others. The label also released a compilation album together, 2018’s Slime Language.

Thug has been cited as an inspiration for many popular artists, including Lil Uzi Vert, Gunna, Lil Baby, NBA YoungBoy, and even the legendary Kanye West. While many have dubbed Thug as a huge musical inspiration, Jeffery himself consistently cites Lil Wayne as his biggest idol and influence, even though they have both publicly spoken about their past issues with one another, which have since been resolved.

Young Thug’s frequent collaborators outside of YSL include Gucci Mane, Migos, Travis Scott, Future, and formerly Rich Homie Quan. Thug has also worked extensively with producers such as Wheezy, London On Da Track, Metro Boomin, TM88, and Southside.

Thug has also officially released collaboration projects with Bloody Jay, Rich Homie Quan, Future, and Chris Brown, along with being a major participant in the group projects Lobby Runners and Bankroll Mafia.

songs.title: Best Friend

description.plain:
“Best Friend” is the fifth song on Thugger’s first edition of Slime Season.  Produced by Young Shad and Ricky Racks, Thug comes hard with his crooning and braggadocios style to brag about his bestie.

This song was met with controversy upon release when Louisiana rapper Tokyo Vanity threatened to sue Thugger. According to Complex Magazine, Vanity is threatening to sue Thugger for copyright infringement, claiming he stole her song “That’s My Best Friend.”

The Fader interviewed the director of the music video, Be El Be, who shared his opinion on who Thuggers “best friend” really is:

If [Young Thug is] his own butler, if he’s catching himself with himself, making love to himself, if he’s in the bathroom getting changed and it’s just him and him—it’s showing his best friend is himself. That self-esteem! He’s a very stylish young man, so I would say that the inside meaning of that is that he is his own best friend.

On September 14th, 2015 the official music video was released by Young Thug. It is co-directed by Be El Be and the visuals show Thugger running into himself in everything he does. Pitchfork said it best (in regards to describing the video):

Young Thug’s video for “Best Friend” begins with Young Thug walking in on Young Thug, who’s in the process of hooking up with Young Thug. Then, Thug jumps in a car driven by Thug. Eventually, Thug’s head is served at a dinner attended by Thug. 

Fun Fact: 5 months later from the release of the music video, Young Thug read out the lyrics on GQ  so people can understand him better and simply for laughs and giggles!

https://youtu.be/IVRXJ1Gd33g

description.plain:
On this track, Young Thug, J. Cole, and Travis Scott rap about what they would do with their significant others at “The London,” which could refer to a luxury hotel in either Beverly Hills or New York. They also boast their stature, wealth, sexual prowess, and ability to sell drugs. It is the lead single from Thug’s 2019 project, titled So Much Fun, and his first official release since his September 2018 EP, On the Rvn.

The single was first teased on May 11, 2019, when flyers were thrown out to attendees of Thug’s set at Miami’s Rolling Loud Festival. They featured the first line of Thug’s verse on the track and teased the song’s artwork and color scheme.
https://twitter.com/1sabsad/status/1127412788354330624

The song was teased again on May 21, 2019, during a since-deleted live stream on Thug’s YouTube channel titled “Meet Me At The London,” which spanned over the course of more than twelve hours. The live stream focused on a woman painting a spider on a green canvas, again foreshadowing the song’s artwork. Travis' involvement was also teased by a woman filling a cactus-shaped piñata with candy.

“The London” received an official release two days later with less than an hour’s notice.

songs.title: Check

description.plain:
Thug teams up with hit maker London on da Track to create a booming new single about all the money he’s racking up. Check out the music video below!

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=RAzzv6Ks9nc

Thug talks about how this song came about in his interview with Clique:

‘Cause at any given time I could learn something and I really want to express it right when I learn it, like, 'Oh wow, pull the beat up.’
I got a check, like, I just got a check: 650,000. I’m in the studio, she bring me the check. I’m like, ‘What the fuck.’ I’m like, ‘Got a check I got a check,’ and just made a song.

songs.full_title: Chanel (Go Get It) by Young Thug (Ft. Gunna & Lil Baby)
songs.title: Chanel (Go Get It)
songs.title_with_featured: Chanel (Go Get It) (Ft. Gunna & Lil Baby)

description.plain:
“Chanel (Go Get It)” sees Thugger, YSL signee Gunna, and fellow ATLien Lil Baby singing about spending time with a female and allowing them to purchase luxury items.

Together the three list off the many designer brands they’d be willing to buy their respective women, such as Chanel, Christian Louboutin, Fendi, Hermès, Gucci, Louis Vuitton, Marc Jacobs, Yves Saint Laurent, and Dior.
Gunna, Baby, and Thugger would also be willing to purchase their women different luxury vehicles including: Bentley Sedans, Mercedes Benz, Lamborghini’s, Porche Cayenne’s, Mercedes G-Wagon’s, and Range Rovers.

When Slime Language’s features were initially announced, Lil Baby wasn’t listed as one of the guests on the project. However, soon after, feature list was updated to include his name. This is because he was only added to “Chanel (Go Get It)” shortly before the song’s release, replacing a verse by Lil Uzi Vert, as revealed in one of the song’s demos that leaked in early November 2018. Thus far, three different demos of the song have leaked: the first with just Thug and Uzi, the second with Thug, Uzi, and Gunna, and the third with Thug, an open verse meant for Baby, and Gunna. This also explains why Baby’s verse was updated a few days after the song’s initial release.

songs.title: Stoner

description.plain:
This song is Young Thug’s first major hit that brought him much attention & made him a major face in the ATL trap scene.

The song’s major themes are addressed the name which is Young Thug’s admiration for / dependance on drugs especially, marijuana.

After a long time of waiting Young Thug finally delivered the official music video for “Stoner” on 10 May 2014. The video includes guest appearances of Birdman, Migos, Fabo and a lot more.

songs.title: Hot

description.plain:
“Hot” serves as YSL Records labelmates Young Thug’s and Gunna’s triumphant ode to their lifestyles. Over a horn heavy instrumental provided by frequent collaborator Wheezy, the two Atlanta natives trend bars and detail their status in the music industry.

“Hot” is the first of the two Gunna features on So Much Fun and quickly turned out to be the album’s breakout hit. The song was supported by a Travis Scott-assisted remix, released two months after the original, with a music video the day after, starring the three friends.

songs.full_title: Hot (Remix) by Young Thug (Ft. Gunna & Travis Scott)
songs.title: Hot (Remix)

description.plain:
Young Thug and Gunna are joined by their friend and frequent collaborator, Travis Scott, for the remix of one of the most popular songs on So Much Fun. The remix features a new verse from Travis, which was accompanied by a music video starring the three artists literally on fire.

Thug posted on his Instagram story a screenshot of “Hot” being exported with an open verse, hinting at a remix. Travis Scott also posted a caption “H🔥T“ on his Instagram story that same day, leading many to believe Travis would be the artist featured on the remix.

On October 28, 2019, the first snippet of Travis' verse leaked online. The following day, a demo of the remix with an open verse where Gunna’s verse usually appeared surfaced online.

This marks the second time that Thug, Gunna, and Travis have all collaborated on the same song, following August 2016’s “Floyd Mayweather.“

songs.title: Relationship

description.plain:
“Relationship” sees Thugger and Future croon over an instrumental reminiscent of early 2000s R&B and brag about their relationships with different women.

This song is their second collaboration since Young Thug and Future’s beef which began in November of 2015 when producer Metro Boomin sent out  a series of tweets that stated Future started the trend of releasing multiple mixtapes per year, and that other artists should focus on dropping one good project. Young Thug, who already released multiple mixtapes that year, believed the tweets were directed at him, and sent multiple shots at Metro. Future also took to Twitter that night with a tweet that many believed was directed towards Thugger.

Another Twitter battle took place between Thug and Future hours before the release of Future’s album EVOL. In September of 2016, Thug publicly apologized to Future, officially squashing their beef. They recently collaborated on the DJ Esco track, “Who”.



This song’s production is handled by BL$$D, producer of the hit song Rolex, and Billboard Hitmakers, a production group who assisted with many of the tracks on Young Thug’s last mixtape Jeffery.

songs.title: Digits

description.plain:
“Digits” is one of the four tracks on Slime Season 3 produced by London On Da Track.

Leading up to the song’s release, fans stitched together snippets of the song from Periscope and Snapchat. “Digits” was officially premiered on Zane Lowe’s Beats Radio, on March 24, 2016. An alternate version with Meek Mill was premiered by Funk Master Flex on April 2, a week after Slime Season 3 was released.

In an interview with the FADER, London on Da Track recalled making “Digits,” “Memo,” “Worth It” and “Tattoo” all in one day. The tracks were at least a year old at the time of release, but he remembered how “Digits” came together:

When he was laying down, he was just freestyling it—just doing melodies in the booth—and I was like, “That’s the shit right there.” Then he figured out the words and from there he just flowed the whole track. It was easy for him, he does it in one take. It’s crazy how he can finish a song in ten minutes.

The first line of the song’s pre-chorus sparked a heated debate that became the subject of various memes about Thug singing “horses don’t stop” instead of “hustlers don’t stop.” Thugger eventually confirmed that he was saying “hustlers,” but his Southern drawl makes “hustlers” sound like “horses.”

songs.title: Wyclef Jean

description.plain:
“Wyclef Jean,” also known as “NASCAR,” is named after Haitian rapper and one of Thugger’s idols Wyclef Jean, best known for being in The Fugees.

Wyclef Jean is also featured on “Kanye West,” the 9th track of this project.

The beat contains elements of Caribbean and Reggae music, almost as an extra nod to Wyclef Jean. The electric guitar chords and bassline are unique to the aforementioned style of music.

songs.title: Halftime

description.plain:
The iconic “Halftime" is an epitome of Young Thug’s unique style. With no hook, innovative vocals and a legendary 11-second-long “Skrrt” ad-lib, “Halftime” displays Thugger’s technical abilities. The rapper uses four minutes to introduce half-a-dozen different flows while elaborating on his lifestyle and threatening his opposition.

The song was released in 2015, at a time when Thug was paving the way for a new rap formula characterized by the ground-breaking vocal instrumentation showcased throughout Barter 6—a project deemed for its impact on the modern trap.

The instrumental of “Halftime” is produced by Thug’s DJ Kip Hilson for the first of their two collaborations, and the accompanying music video is directed by Thug’s friend and frequent collaborator Be EL Be, who managed Thug’s controversial and celebrated “Best Friend” video.

songs.full_title: Guwop by Young Thug (Ft. Offset, Quavo & Young Scooter)
songs.title: Guwop

description.plain:
This song is named after Gucci Mane (A.K.A Guwop), an Atlanta rapper considered to be one of the founding fathers of trap and is responsible for the way trap music is today.

On May 26th 2016, Gucci Mane was released from prison after spending two years locked up for possession of a firearm. Just a month later, he released his album Everybody Looking which also featured Jeffery on the track “Guwop Home”.

GUWOP also has a meaning to it, explained by Gucci himself on Twitter: https://twitter.com/gucci1017/status/524742715465277440

On this track, Jeffery, along with Young Scooter and Quavo and Offset of Migos pay homage to the godfather of trap.

description.plain: “Again” is the thirteenth track off Young Thug’s mixtape Slime Season. Gucci’s verse is sampled from the intro to his mixtape Trap House 4. When asked about it, engineer Alex Tumay stated it was London On Da Track’s idea to reuse the verse for “Again.”

songs.title: Hercules

description.plain:
In the days leading up to the release of the song, Young Thug and Metro beefed after the producer sent out a tweet that Thugger thought was aimed at him. A lot of fans thought it was a publicity stunt to promote their new release, but Thugger and Metro both claim it was real—and now squashed.

https://twitter.com/MetroBoomin/status/665050848318263296

While this track was officially released at 10:22 PM on November 12th, 2015, Thug previewed the full track live on Periscope at 5:55 AM the previous day.

It features three up and coming new school artists: the hottest in the south, Young Thug; Harlem’s very own, ASAP Ferg; and midwest gangbanger, Freddie Gibbs all rapping over a hot trap beat to make an absolute banger.

songs.title: Givenchy

description.plain:
The opening track for the Rich Gang mixtape Tha Tour Part 1.

This song is all about flashy lifestyle, but most importantly Givenchy, a French luxury brand that is currently extremely popular amongst rappers and celebrities in general.

songs.full_title: Floyd Mayweather by Young Thug (Ft. Gucci Mane, Gunna & Travis Scott)
songs.title: Floyd Mayweather
songs.title_with_featured: Floyd Mayweather (Ft. Gucci Mane, Gunna & Travis Scott)

description.plain:
Young Thug, Travis Scott, Gunna & Gucci rap about a luxury lifestyle on “Floyd Mayweather”, the track is named after American boxer Floyd Mayweather Jr., who is nicknamed “Money” and “Pretty Boy.”

Floyd Mayweather actually almost signed Young Thug to his TMT music label in the past. They’ve also been spotted in the studio together this year.

Thug has mentioned Mayweather before numerous songs, including “Heart Attack”, “Mind Right”, and “Yamborghini Dream”.

There are three versions of the song. The original release did not include Travis Scott and a Gunna verse, but it was later updated on Apple Music and other streaming services to include the Gunna verse after Gucci and the Travis verse after the next Thug verse. In the third version, which is now the one playing on all streaming services, the Gunna verse comes in before the Gucci verse with another bar at the beginning, and the rest of the song is mostly similar to the second version.

Although Young Thug and Travis Scott have collaborated on eight prior songs, this song along with “Pick Up the Phone” mark the first time Travis Scott has ever appeared on one of Thug’s projects.

songs.title: Anybody

description.plain:
“Anybody” is the first single of 2018 by Atlanta artist Young Thug, with his first collaboration with Nicki Minaj since 2014’s “Danny Glover” remix.

The song was leaked two days ahead of its expected release on April 13, 2018, and it came as somewhat of a surprise to fans considering that Thugger previously said he wouldn’t be releasing any music in 2018.

On April 10, both artists hinted at the song’s release after they both tweeted the number “3”. Thug’s go-to engineer, Alex Tumay, also joined in, further adding to the speculation.

songs.title: Harambe

description.plain:
Young Thug named this song to honor Harambe, the beloved gorilla who was killed after a child fell into his enclosure at the Cincinnati Zoo on May 28, 2016.

Thug pays his respects to and remembers Harambe with this track. He said on Twitter that the songs were named after his idols, making Harambe the youngest idol on the album, aged just 17 at his death.

After the shooting, there was controversy as to whether or not killing Harambe was the right decision. While some claimed that it was justified, others disagree, claiming that the tragic death could have been avoided.

In August 2016, 2 and a half months after Harambe died, a new wave of memes surfaced, spawning multiple opinion pieces on the topic. This track has ensured the matter remains in the public eye.

songs.full_title: Take Kare by Young Thug (Ft. Lil Wayne)
songs.title: Take Kare

description.plain:
After joining Birdman’s Rich Gang group with Rich Homie Quan and releasing multiple tracks with the group, most notably the  banger “Lifestyle,” Thugger finally releases a collaboration with the inspiration for his music career, Lil Wayne. Note the Blood influence in the title – both Thugger and Wayne are Bloods, so the “C” in “Care” is replaced with a “K”, in typical anti-Crip fashion.

Almost a year after releasing it as a single, Young Thug made this song the opening track to his mixtape, Slime Season.

One of our own, Brian Duricy, wrote this article
 regarding this song and the passing of the metaphorical torch from Lil Wayne to Young Thug.

songs.title: Feel It

description.plain: “Feel It” is a love song about how much Young Thug appreciates his long-term girlfriend, Jerrika Karlae. Karlae originally uploaded a snippet  of “Feel It” to her Instagram in April 2015. After many more previews of the song were teased, the song leaked in early 2017. It was later re-mixed and mastered, and the song eventually found its home on Thug’s 2017 project, BEAUTIFUL THUGGER GIRLS.

songs.title: Bad Bad Bad

description.plain:
On “Bad Bad Bad,” Thug and Lil Baby team up for a track where they brag about all the luxurious brands they can afford to buy for women and themselves.

This is hardly the first collaboration between the two rappers, with the Baby appearing most notably on Thug’s 2018 track “Chanel (Go Get It),” and Thug appearing on Baby’s 2017 track “Right Now” and 2018 track “Section 8.”

songs.full_title: Family Don't Matter by Young Thug (Ft. Millie Go Lightly)
songs.title: Family Don’t Matter
songs.title_with_featured: Family Don't Matter (Ft. Millie Go Lightly)

description.plain:
In “Family Don’t Matter,” Young Thug kicks off BEAUTIFUL THUGGER GIRLS, setting the country-trap tone for the rest of the album. The song itself discusses his relationships with close friends and associates, alongside Young Thug staples such as flaunting weapons and drug use.

Interestingly, on the song’s SoundCloud release, it bears the title “Like Family Don’t Matter” and features the “Icebox” interlude in the beginning instead of the end of the song.

Originally, both Thug and Millie Go Lightly each recorded their own solo songs over the same Wheezy beat. One day, Wheezy realized this and played Millie’s demo for Thug, and Thug liked it so much that he had her re-record her vocals for a verse and harmonies on his version of the song.

songs.full_title: F Cancer (Boosie) by Young Thug (Ft. Quavo)
songs.title: F Cancer (Boosie)

description.plain:
Young Thug’s first single off of his highly anticipated mixtape I’m Up is the surprisingly upbeat and bouncy track “Fuck Cancer.”

The song’s title is inspired by Thug’s friend Boosie Badazz (né Lil Boosie) who recently had surgery to remove a cancerous tumor from his kidney.

The music video explains how the subject matter of the song relates to the song’s title. Boosie makes a guest appearance in the video and they celebrate his overcoming cancer. So the song is about celebrating Boosie’s life and ability to have fun/party now that he’s overcome cancer.

songs.full_title: You Said by Young Thug (Ft. Quavo)
songs.title: You Said

description.plain: In “You Said”, the seventh track off Beautiful Thugger Girls, Young Thug describes a relationship between himself and a woman. In this song, she seems to promise a lot to him, yet always fails to deliver. While she seems to have a sexual attraction to Thugga, it seems to be nothing more than that. Post-release, the song was updated to feature a new verse from Quavo.

songs.title: The Blanguage

description.plain:
Young Thug’s version of Drake’s “The Language”. The name of the song is even taken, and the letter B is added to symbolize Young Thug’s affiliation with the Blood Gang.

Note how his flow is similar to Drake’s from the original song, and how even the cover art pays homage to one of his earlier mixtapes, So Far Gone.

description.plain:
This song, now called “Kanye West,” went through numerous title changes before and after its release; previous titles included “Elton John,” “Wet Wet,” and “Pop Man.”

This song—at the time called “Pop Man”—was the first single released from JEFFERY, the tape previously known as No, My Name is JEFFERY, and Young Thug. This is Thug’s first collaboration with Wyclef Jean, and Thugger later named track one of JEFFERY in his honor.

The production is handled by Wheezy and Zaytoven’s right hand man, Cassius Jay, who’s influence on the beat is clearest in the keyboard melody found in the pre-hook—which is reminiscent of his mentor Zaytoven’s preferred instrumentation.

description.plain:
Aside from Young Thug’s typical typical topics of drugs, women and cars, Yak Gotti joins him for their first collaboration since “Dream” on Barter 6. Yak uses his 8 bars to take shots at Young Money rapper FLOW.

The song was first previewed right before Barter 6 dropped, in the infamous “with them dicks” video where Thugger challenges Flow to pull up to Hollygrove for B6’s release.

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=6_-U9NumQ0c

songs.title: Safe

description.plain:
“Safe” was a surprise drop by Young Thug on February 23, 2017. In this track, Thugga talks about many of the insecurities that are overshadowed by his public reputation. Often finding himself in the spotlight for various reasons, whether positive or negative , Young Thug proves that he has more going on underneath the surface than we realize.

The track is Thug’s first release since 2016’s JEFFERY mixtape.

songs.full_title: Yea Yea by Young Thug (Ft. Travis Scott)
songs.title: Yea Yea

description.plain:
“Yea Yea” was originally leaked on August 11th, 2016.

The song was originally meant to be a single for Young Thug’s 2016 mixtape, Jeffery, before it leaked. Engineer Alex Tumay stated that he was in the middle of mixing the song when it leaked, and the single was immediately scrapped. Interestingly enough, the leaked file’s name was spelled “Yea Yea,” but when the song was teased on Lyor Cohen’s Snapchat story, it was spelled “Yeah Yeah.”

songs.title: Climax

description.plain:
“Climax” is the first collaboration between Young Thug and 6LACK. Although it is their first collaboration, 6LACK dedicated an interlude on his sophomore studio album to Thug.

On the song’s chorus, Thug interpolates Shiloh Dynasty’s “Losing Interest,” which can be heard here.

On August 15, 2018, 6LACK posted an image of himself in the studio with Thug, which may be when this song was recorded.

On September 23, 2018, Thug posted a trailer for On the Rvn on Instagram. Within the trailer was a portion of the beginning of this song.

6LACK was formerly a battle rapper in college, and in this video he is seen battling against Thug, proving they have known each other for quite some time.

songs.full_title: Webbie by Young Thug (Ft. Lil Duke)
songs.title: Webbie

description.plain:
The title of the song likely refers to the rapper Webbie.

Like many of the song titles in this album, Webbie was likely chosen as the title because he is one of the artists from which Young Thug draws inspiration.

Webbie, a rapper from Baton Rouge, has also collaborated with Boosie Badazz, whom Young Thug gave tribute to in “F Cancer” after he was diagnosed with cancer.

Young Thug has mentioned on Instagram how each song on the mixtape was named after one of his idols.

songs.full_title: Just How It Is by Young Thug
songs.title: Just How It Is

description.plain:
“Just How It Is” is the intro to Young Thug’s August 2019 album So Much Fun. The song is introspective (a tone suggested by the title) and sees Young Thug genuinely elaborating on his rap star status and on what it implies on his lifestyle.

I’m telling you just how it is

The song was first teased by Young Thug in July 2019, and came with an accompanying music video released exactly one month after the song.

songs.title: RiRi

description.plain:
The title of this track is referencing pop artist Rihanna.

Throughout the hook Thug repeats the word “work,” which is likely referencing Rihanna’s hit track “Work” from her 2016 album, ANTI.

The track is produced by Wheezy, a producer who was prevalent on Young Thug’s last album, Barter 6.

songs.full_title: What’s the Move by Young Thug (Ft. Lil Uzi Vert)
songs.title: What’s the Move
songs.title_with_featured: What’s the Move (Ft. Lil Uzi Vert)

description.plain:
On “What’s the Move,” Atlanta rapper Young Thug teams up with Philadelphia star Lil Uzi Vert for the melodic banger. Lil Uzi and Thugger question the direction of the relationship and wonder what the next step is for them. Uzi specifically boasts about his expensive name-brand clothing and his designer brands, while Thugger tells his girl that she can get whatever she’d like and reflects on her physical aspects.

The duo are frequent collaborators and have worked together on some of their most successful tracks to date, such as October 2015’s “Yamborghini Dream” and April 2018’s “Up.”

A music video for the track was released October 11th, 2019 featuring both Thug and Uzi.

description.plain: “Sup Mate” features Thug reuniting with his Super Slimey partner and friend Future for an energetic trap banger. On the song, the two Atlanta trap veterans use 4 minutes to go back and forth and challenge their opposition with aggressive flows.
